item.title: Claude introduces memory for teams at work
item.description: Claude now remembers your team's projects and preferences across conversations. Memory helps maintain context for complex work, with project-specific boundaries and full user control over what's remembered.

item.title: Programming With Less Than Nothing
item.description: Lambda calculus is for wimps. Real programmers use combinatory logic.

item.title: VST 3.8.0 SDK Released - Developer / VST 3 SDK - Steinberg Forums
item.description: VST 3.8 SDK Released Dear VST Developers, Steinberg Media Technologies today releases the VST SDK 3.8 Here’s a brief overview of changes: Version 3.8.0 (2025/10/20) New licensing model for VST 3: VST 3 is now open source, released under the MIT license. Interface changes: Support for MIDI 2.0: new interfaces IMidiLearn2 and IMidiMapping2. These new interfaces replace the previous interfaces IMidiLearn and IMidiMapping. Add missing ControllerNumbers enum for MIDI 1.0 System messages...

item.title: The Body Keeps the Score is Bullshit
item.description: The popular book from the "world's most famous living psychiatrist" is riddled with blatant misrepresentations

item.title: Hacking Formula 1: Accessing Max Verstappen's passport and PII through FIA bugs
item.description: We found vulnerabilities in the FIA's Driver Categorisation platform, allowing us to access PII and password hashes of any racing driver with a categorisation rating.

item.title: Google flags Immich sites as dangerous | Immich Blog
item.description: How Google actively breaks Immich deployments, an open-source Google Photos alternative

item.title: JMAP for Calendars, Contacts and Files now in Stalwart | Stalwart Labs
item.description: After four years of development, we’re thrilled to announce a major milestone in the evolution of Stalwart — the full implementation of JMAP for Calendars, Contacts, Address Books, File Storage, and Sharing. With this release, Stalwart becomes the first JMAP server to fully support the entire family of JMAP collaboration protocols, marking a new era for open, efficient, and elegant groupware.
item.author: (https://github.com/mdecimus)
